summary: The 'Ensuring Lasting Smiles Act' (S. 1677) mandates health insurance coverage for outpatient and inpatient services related to the diagnosis and treatment of congenital anomalies and birth defects impacting the eyes, ears, teeth, mouth, or jaw. The bill details coverage requirements for group health plans and individual health insurance, including services to improve function/appearance, reconstructive procedures, and adjunctive support. It also requires notices to participants and beneficiaries, defines congenital anomalies, and mandates a study on provider network adequacy. The amendments take effect on or after January 1, 2026.
